name: Cosmo Hotel Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I walked into the hotel lobby, I guess it gave the expection of the room. The lobby is small, practical and trendy. We walked to the reception desk and we were greeted by a friendly staff.
reviews.title: Trendy, Small, funny location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After fill in the check-in form and passport inspection, I was asked to give a deposit of HK$300. This is not my first time I have encountered such request in Hong Kong, it is more or less normal practice. The staff informed us that we have got an "upgrade" and we prompty went upstairs by the lift to see our upgraded room.
reviews.title: Stylish, Good Value for Hong Kong, Good services

likes.disliked: — Not the best service for this class of hotel, location kind of dull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the lobby of the hotel did set the scence of the room. I remember I use the word "cute" when I first walked into the room. The first impression of the room was small and smart.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: The room is clean and tidy. The person who did the interior design of the room do manage to use every inch of the room without wasting any space.
reviews.title: A Lovely Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: In the room I stayed it has 2 single beds within the bedroom, next to one of the bed is a "semi-glass wall" partition between the bathroom and bedroom, this partition does give a trendy atmosphere to the room. Next to the other bed is the windown of the room, the window is sealed and can't be opened.
reviews.title: Cosmo is Terrible

reviews.text: Totally agree with the review written by "ballina" below. Thought of writing something but I think that review has pretty much covered everything.
reviews.title: Good Value Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: For me, i just take a short 10 mins walk to Times Square and Causeway Bay area. Else you can always wait for the free shuttle at the Cosmopolitan hotel next door which is under the same management.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Rooms are nicely done up with a modern chic theme. For this price (I paid about US$90 per night), i think it's already very "BIG" for Hong Kong hotels! What more can you ask for right?
reviews.title: Most Modern and Hip Hotel in Hong Kong

likes.liked: — The Noorch Bar, The Internet Access, The convenience (Bus stop outside the hotel), The style inside the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's clean and new, that's what i like best... wonder where the "smelly" odour comes from in the previous review!
reviews.title: very smelly

likes.disliked: — terrible pervasive smell and seedy atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cab to Lan Kwai Fong at 11pm only sets me back by about S$10 one way. And trust me, it's really fast at night without the peak traffic!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the COSMO Hotel over a weekend in early October. The rooms are very small and the staff unfriendly. Location is not close to much except the HK convention centre (abt 10 mins cab ride). It is a 15 mins walk to the nearest train station (Wan Chai) and food outlets are near the station. We paid HKD 1,800 + 13% tax and yet had a tiny room. We had previously stayed in many hotels in HK and this has the be the worst value for money given the service level and room size.
reviews.title: Expensive with bad service level

reviews.text: Stayed at their sister hotel, The Cosmopolitan, in March and thought it would be a similar experience. Quite the opposite. The rooms are very, very small and on one side they face the cemetary. They use frosted window to try to cover it up. We payed a little extra to switch to a bigger room. The room had a computer with internet access and came with breakfast everyday. The bathroom was is extremely small. There is no room to put any tolietries in the bathroom or to move around.
reviews.title: horrible experience
Very disappointed
reviews.text: On our 3rd night , we noticed a smell (smelled musty, like dirty feet) whenever we turned the air conditioning up to 25 degrees celcius. The next morning, I informed the front desk about the smell and their solution was to turn down the air and they would bring us extra blankets and a heater if we were cold. We decided it wasnt a big deal. The next day, there was an even stronger smell , almost like gas. At first I ignored it, but then I started to feel dizzy so I went to the front desk to inform them about it. They told me they were painting the room next door. Why didnt anyone tell us that morning they were going to be painting? The hotels are very small and there is basically no ventilation. We left the hotel and the smell was still there when we returned in the late afternoon. They switched us to a different room only after they made sure we went upstairs to check if the smell was still there. They never once apologized for it.

The staff wasn't always friendly. It depended on who was at the front desk. The only thing I liked about the hotel was their shuttle bus service. Their shuttle bus service takes you to the convention center, Times Square, and the Airport Express train. If you dont mind the smells, the cemetary, and the extremely small rooms and bathrooms (smallest of the 4 Hong Kong hotels I've stayed at) then I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Tiny hotel, tiny lobby, tiny rooms

likes.liked: — Good quality duvets, slippers, robes, toiletries
likes.disliked: — Size of room, lobby and building (usual for HK though)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It cost me $1,100 HK dollar /night for a room that is the size of my own bathroom. the room are all cover by white paint. location is inconvience. however they do have shuttle bus that circle between causeway bay subway station (Time square) and several different location. I am seriously doubt about that 4 star rating which they posted at hotel.com. over all is a very bad deal.
reviews.title: It was a Nice Stay.

likes.disliked: — I think the ventilation of the Hotel rooms lobby and the lift needs a little help. There seems to have a dampness smell.

description: Booking this hotel online to enjoy 100M Free WiFi in-room, flexible 24-hour check-in time and a full 24-hour stay! (for hotel official site booking only)A boutique hotel in downtown Causeway Bay and Wan Chai, close to Causeway Bay metro station (8-min walking distance). Free shuttle bus to 15 locations on the Hong Kong island. This young and chic Cosmo Hotel Hong Kong is 100% smoke-free,and dedicates to sustainability as represented by its Green Globe Certified Hotel status and being a Green City Hotel award-winner.
